revised_title: Neuronal Somata in Primate Motor and Somatic Sensory Cortices: A Qualitative and Quantitative Study
tldr: This study examines the neuronal somata in the motor and somatic sensory cortices of monkeys using electron microscopy. It identifies and describes different types of neurons, including pyramidal, large stellate, and small stellate cells, and their characteristics. A quantitative analysis of these cells in both cortical areas reveals similar proportions of each type of neuron, providing evidence that large and small stellate cells form distinct populations.
